OUR
PROGRAMS

Kingdom Hoops

The core of our outreach is our basketball program. Through Kingdom Hoops we are able to offer youth a unique development opportunity and platform to 300-400 youth annually. While we offer elite basketball training, our environment is one that creates integrative inclusion – a setting where diverse groups of youth come together, create relationships, and achieve goals together. Last year, students from over 50 school districts in the state of Iowa to participated in Kingdom Hoops.

From a basketball standpoint, our focus remains in the fundamentals and skill development of each athlete in the program no matter age or level. The opportunity for youth to participate in Kingdom Hoops goes beyond training in our Des Moines facility as our teams travel and compete in national events. The AAU basketball model offers a unique exposure opportunity for student-athletes. Each year, 90% of the student-athletes on our top 17U program go on to receive some form of an athletic or academic scholarship. The Kingdom Hoops program is a process and our staff is committed to coming alongside and tailoring the experience to the youth we serve. We believe basketball is the beginning, our vision is to create an experience where youth are able to reach their athletic goals, while growing spiritually and developing relationships along the way.

Kingdom Hoops

Kingdom Hoops
Academies

Beyond Ball

Beyond Ball is a program that helps provide additional opportunity off the basketball court for the youth we serve. Our organization is a place where youth from various different economic and ethnic backgrounds can come together and work for a common goal, a place where skill, dedication, and hard work are taught, and where opportunity is first found. Our goal is to walk alongside our student-athletes that live in the inner city of Des Moines, Iowa by providing athletic scholarships, tutoring, meals, and mentorship.

Through this program, we envision all of our students pursuing higher education, becoming leaders in their communities and families, and receiving athletic college scholarships. Although financial support is a key factor, we believe that true impact can only be reached through deep, long-term relationships. Mentors and coaches are there to support the spiritual and character development of these students.

Kingdom Hoops Teams

Kingdom Hoops is an annual program, meaning our teams practice and train multiple days per week while traveling to tournaments throughout the year. Our reams run Kindergarten through 11th grade. To learn more about joining a Kingdom Hoops team, check us out at Kingdom Hoops.

Kingdom Hoops Academies

Kingdom Hoops academies are included in membership tuition and are also open to the public. Each year, we offer a host of camps focusing on various, specific developmental areas. To enroll or learn more, check us out at Kingdom Hoops.

Feeding Program

The Beyond Ball food program was created in October of 2014 when our staff began to notice a pattern of children asking to grab snacks from the concession stand. Through the help of many dedicated families, we began to provide dinner four times per week to over 40 children. Many of the youth who participate in our basketball programs will spend all day and evening in our facility. We are thankful for the many families who have chosen to serve and come alongside our program to help make this program possible. We rely on volunteers to provide meals each week – if you are interested in volunteering please check out our Beyond Ball page.

Mentoring Program

The Mentorship Program is focused on strengthening the community of support that each child has. Each mentor relationship is different, but essential in the development of the student. For more information on becoming a mentor please contact John Lamb .
